batch_info.description: First batch of synthetic clinical documents for healthcare AI demo

expected_detections.document_a: HRA (hra_2024-11-01.txt) reports current smoker, half pack per day, 30+ years
expected_detections.expected_finding: Smoking status is contradictory - determine true smoking status for accurate risk assessment

expected_detections.signal: Depression documented in prior year but not in current records
expected_detections.expected_finding: Major Depressive Disorder (F32.1) was active in 2023 problem list but not mentioned in current intake documents. PHQ-9 of 14 in November 2024 note suggests depression is still present.
Lab results show eGFR declining from 72 to 52 over 6 months, indicating Stage 3a CKD. CKD is not documented in the problem list.
Heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF) was newly diagnosed by cardiology on 08/20/2024 but may not be in official problem list yet

expected_detections.signal: HF medications prescribed without formal HF diagnosis in problem list
expected_detections.expected_finding: Patient is on carvedilol, spironolactone, furosemide (GDMT for heart failure) - verify HFrEF is added to problem list
HRA shows multiple depression indicators: feeling sad 'often', difficulty sleeping, fatigue, low energy, poor concentration. Combined with PHQ-9 of 14 - depression should be actively managed.
Prior year problem list shows 'CKD Stage 3' (N18.3) but latest labs show eGFR 35 which is Stage 3b (N18.32). Diagnosis staging should be updated.

expected_detections.signal: Anxiety disorder in prior year but not in current documentation
expected_detections.expected_finding: Generalized Anxiety Disorder (F41.1) documented in 2023 problem list but not mentioned in any current progress notes or HRA
Severe obstructive sleep apnea (AHI 42) diagnosed via sleep study on 08/28/2024. OSA diagnosis needs to be added to problem list.
Patient admits to taking Eliquis once daily instead of twice due to medication cost concerns. This is a critical stroke risk in patient with AFib (CHA2DS2-VASc = 5).

expected_detections.signal: OSA symptoms in HRA before diagnosis
expected_detections.expected_finding: HRA from October shows loud snoring, witnessed apneas, morning headaches, unrefreshing sleep, daytime sleepiness - classic OSA cluster that was later confirmed by sleep study

expected_detections.signal: Classic diabetes symptoms led to diagnosis
expected_detections.expected_finding: Initial presentation in January 2024 showed classic diabetes symptoms (polyuria, polydipsia, fatigue, blurred vision) plus family history - appropriately led to diabetes diagnosis
Labs show ACR 44 mg/g (moderately increased albuminuria) indicating early diabetic nephropathy. 'Diabetic nephropathy' or 'CKD' should be documented as diagnosis.
HRA shows loud snoring, witnessed apneas (wife reports stopping breathing then gasping), morning fatigue, poor sleep quality in obese patient. OSA has not been evaluated.

expected_detections.signal: Diabetic retinopathy mentioned but may not be in problem list
expected_detections.expected_finding: October 2024 note mentions 'mild per ophthalmology' for diabetic eye changes. Verify diabetic retinopathy is documented in problem list.
Patient with DM, HTN, obesity, family history of early MI reports new palpitations. Holter monitor ordered - results should be followed up.

expected_detections.signal: Language barrier and medication cost concerns
expected_detections.expected_finding: HRA reveals medication cost concerns and difficulty understanding health information even with interpreter. Health literacy and financial barriers should be addressed.
HbA1c improved from 5.7% (prediabetes) to 5.5% (normal). Consider updating diagnosis from 'prediabetes' to 'history of prediabetes, resolved' while continuing monitoring due to risk factors.

patients.notes: This patient serves as a clean baseline with well-coordinated care. Only minor documentation improvement opportunity exists. Demonstrates what good care coordination looks like.

expected_detections.signal: Lung nodule requiring surveillance not followed up
expected_detections.expected_finding: 8mm indeterminate RLL lung nodule found on CT chest 01/25/2024. Radiology recommended 3-month follow-up CT per Fleischner guidelines. February note mentioned ordering for May, but May and September notes show NO follow-up CT was performed. This is a CRITICAL PATIENT SAFETY ISSUE in a high-risk former smoker (40 pack-years) with family history of lung cancer.

expected_detections.signal: Anxiety disorder not in current documentation
expected_detections.expected_finding: Anxiety Disorder (F41.9) was documented in 2023 problem list (developed after cardiac surgery) but not mentioned in any 2024 notes
Peripheral Vascular Disease (I73.9) with ABI 0.8 documented in 2023 but not mentioned in current year documentation
Bilateral carotid artery stenosis (I65.23) - moderate stenosis on duplex - documented in 2023 but not mentioned in 2024 notes. Should have surveillance imaging.
Shingrix dose 1 given March 2023, dose 2 never administered. Series incomplete.
Prior year shows CKD Stage 3 but labs show eGFR 45 which is Stage 3b

expected_detections.signal: MCI confirmed but may not be in problem list
expected_detections.expected_finding: MMSE 26/30 in September 2024 confirms mild cognitive impairment. Should be added to problem list for tracking.

validation_instructions.purpose: This answer key is for validating the agentic suspect detection system's accuracy
usage: Run the detection agent on each patient's document bundle
Compare agent findings against expected_detections for each patient
Pay special attention to critical findings (CVD-2025-005 lung nodule)
Note any false positives or novel true detections not in this key
